name: Abdominal Stabilization
how_to_perform:
1. Start by lying on your back on a flat, stable surface with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
2. Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine, keeping your pelvis in a neutral position.
3. Take a deep breath in and hold it for 5 seconds while maintaining the engaged core.
4. Exhale slowly over another 5-10 seconds, still maintaining engagement of the abs.
5. Repeat this process several times to begin feeling stabilization in the core muscles.

**Note:** Focus on maintaining a stable spine, drawing your belly button towards your back, and engaging your transverse abdominis muscle throughout the exercise.
short_summary: A bodyweight core stabilizing exercise that engages the abdominal muscles to maintain stability and control the pelvis, promoting good posture and low-back health.
